statements.name: PROC GREMOVE
statements.description: Identifies the input and output map data sets.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the map data set that is to be processed.

arguments.name: DROPVARS
arguments.description: requests the removal of most of the variables from the input map data set.

arguments.name: FUZZ=
arguments.description: specifies a tolerance for possible error in the data.

arguments.name: NODECYCLE
arguments.description: specifies that the GREMOVE procedure use a topological algorithm for closing the resulting polygons.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the new map data set, which contains the coordinates of the new unit areas created by the GREMOVE procedure.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Lists the variable or variables that identify the new unit areas.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the input map data set that define the new unit areas. Variable(s) can be either numeric or character.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: indicates that the input map data set is sorted in descending order.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations with the same BY-variable values are to be grouped as they are encountered without regard for whether the values are in alphabetical or numerical order.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Identifies the variable or variables that define the hierarchy of the current unit areas in the input map data set.

arguments.name: id-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the input map data set that identify the unit areas to be combined. These variables are not included in the output map data set. Id-variable(s) can be either numeric or character.
